headline.main: DONOVAN CONFERS WITH TURKS' CHIEFS; Roosevelt Envoy Is Reported Finding Ankara and U.S. Agree on War Outlook EFFECT ON BALKANS SEEN Backing for Bulgarian Peace Aims Said to Be Offered if Sofia Shuns Axis

lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Feb. 2 -- Colonel William J. Donovan, President Roosevelt's special envoy, had luncheon today at the British Embassy in Ankara. Tonight he dined with several Turkish officials and army officers whom he met yesterday and today.
abstract: conf with Turkish chiefs; Turkish press comment

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

snippet: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Feb. 2 -- Colonel William J. Donovan, President Roosevelt's special envoy, had luncheon today at the British Embassy in Ankara. Tonight he dined with several Turkish officials and army officers whom he met yesterday and today....

byline.original: BY Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES
